tasks: Review Tesler's Law (lawsofux.com) and explain how it applies to your current design work. Write a 2-page report detailing at least 3 examples of how Tesler's Law can be used to improve user experience.

Create a simple wireframe for a login flow, focusing on the importance of clear typography and color contrast. Use the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design (nngroup.com) as a reference point.
Conduct a self-assessment of your current design process. Identify at least 2 areas where you can improve your UX Fundamentals skills, and create a plan to address them in the next week.

Apply Hick’s Law (lawsofux.com) to redesign your current navigation menu. Use the Aesthetic-Usability Effect (lawsofux.com) as a reference point to ensure your design is both functional and visually appealing.

Create a user persona for a hypothetical product, using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework to inform your research. Write a 2-page report detailing at least 3 pain points you identified during your research.
Review your current portfolio and identify areas where you can improve your UI Craft & Visual Design skills. Create a plan to address these weaknesses in the next week.
Develop a product strategy for a hypothetical product, using the Laws of UX as a reference point. Write a 2-page report detailing at least 3 key takeaways from your research.
Conduct 2 user interviews and document 5 pain points using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework. Use this information to inform your design decisions moving forward.

Redesign your current homepage using the 8-point grid system. Focus on creating a clear and concise navigation menu, while also ensuring that your visual design is both aesthetically pleasing and functional.

Create a comprehensive UX strategy for a hypothetical product, incorporating all of the skills you've learned throughout this program. Write a 2-page report detailing at least 3 key takeaways from your research.

Develop a prototype for your current design project, using user feedback to inform your design decisions. Focus on creating a functional and visually appealing design that meets the needs of your users.
Conduct a final self-assessment of your UX Fundamentals skills. Identify at least 2 areas where you've improved, and create a plan to continue growing in these areas moving forward.

resources.readup: As an emerging senior UX designer, it's time to elevate your skills and take on more complex projects. Focus on bridging the gaps in your strengths - UI Craft & Visual Design and Product Thinking & Strategy - by developing a deeper understanding of user research, validation, and collaboration to drive business outcomes.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Applying Hick's Law to UI Design
topics.summary: Understanding how the amount of time required to complete a task affects user behavior and designing interfaces accordingly.
practice_points: Conduct 3 usability testing sessions with participants completing a simple task (e.g., filling out a form) and analyze the results using Hick's Law as a guiding principle
Create a set of 5 UI elements (e.g., buttons, dropdowns, text inputs) with varying response times and evaluate their impact on user experience
Design 2 interactive prototypes that incorporate Hick's Law principles to optimize the time required for users to complete tasks

topics.name: Crafting Aesthetic-Usability Effect in Visual Design
topics.summary: Understanding how visual design elements influence user perception and designing interfaces that balance aesthetics with usability.
practice_points: Create a mood board with 5 color palettes inspired by different art movements (e.g., Impressionism, Cubism) and evaluate their impact on user experience
Design 3 wireframes for a hypothetical product using a consistent visual design language that incorporates the Aesthetic-Usability Effect principles
Conduct 2 usability testing sessions with participants completing a task while exposed to different visual design elements (e.g., color, typography) and analyze the results

topics.name: Validating User Research Findings using Zeigarnik Effect
topics.summary: Understanding how the Zeigarnik Effect influences user behavior and designing interfaces that capitalize on this phenomenon to improve user engagement.
practice_points: Conduct 2 interviews with participants using the Zeigarnik Effect framework to identify pain points and opportunities for improvement
Create a set of 5 user personas based on research findings and analyze how they relate to the Zeigarnik Effect principles
Design 3 interactive prototypes that incorporate the Zeigarnik Effect principles to create a sense of engagement and motivation
